items.title: Burkina Faso-captain Traor√© voelt druk: 'Ik wil de Afrika Cup een keer winnen'
items.summary: Bertrand Traor√© voelt druk met Burkina Faso op de Afrika Cup. De aanvoerder van het land maakt zich op voor zijn zesde editie van het toernooi, dat hij ook wel eens wil winnen voordat hij met interlandpensioen gaat.

items.title: Zuid-Koreaanse Excelsior-huurling terug naar Brighton, Dordrecht wil profiteren
items.summary: Do-young Yoon vertrekt na een half jaar alweer bij Excelsior. De Zuid-Koreaan keert terug naar Brighton & Hove Albion en gaat dan waarschijnlijk naar FC Dordrecht.

items.title: Stoelendans bij trainers? 'NEC vindt Correia interessante trainer'
items.summary: In VI ZSM hebben Sander Janssen en Sjoerd Keizer het over de leider van het VI-klassement Anthony Correia, runner-up Dick Schreuder en nummer drie Peter Bosz. De trainer van Telstar zou best weleens de opvolger kunnen worden van NEC-trainer Schreuder, die op zijn beurt Bosz zou kunnen opvolgen bij PSV.

items.title: Rondje Boxing Day: 'Premier League is de beste competitie ter wereld'
items.summary: Het is tijd voor een speciale aflevering van Rondje Buitenland: Rondje Boxing Day! De kenners buitenlands voetbal S√ºleyman √ñzt√ºrk en Bas van den Hoven schuiven aan bij presentator Matthijs Vegter om het alleen maar over de Premier League te hebben!

items.title: Duel tussen Nottingham Forest en Manchester City zaterdag niet bij Viaplay te zien
items.summary: Hoewel de Premier League-rechten bij Viaplay liggen, wordt de wedstrijd tussen Nottingham Forest en Manchester City zaterdag niet uitgezonden door de streamingdienst. Door een deal met Prime Video is die pot op dat platform exclusief te zien.

items.title: What were the best moments of the 2025 F1 season? Have your say!
items.summary: After a thrilling 2025 Formula 1 season, Sky Sports' digital F1 journalists have selected their favourite moments for you to vote on.

items.title: ‚ÄòThis is something he is never going to forget‚Äô: Arsenal stars bring festive joy to Great Ormond Street
items.summary: Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Magalh√£es among those playing games with children, some of whom have been receiving treatment for several years There‚Äôs a buzz going around Great Ormond Street hospital‚Äôs Koala ward. After the England captain, Leah Williamson, and her Arsenal teammate Steph Catley visited the previous week, rumours have been spreading that there could be some more very special guests arriving in the buildup to Christmas. ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs a little bit of a rumble,‚Äù says Danny Bell, a specialist paediatric physiotherapist in neuro-oncology who works with children recovering from brain tumours. ‚ÄúI can see an Arsenal shirt out there, so that might just be a very big coincidence! They may know the team involved, but I don‚Äôt think they know any individuals. So I‚Äôm really looking forward to seeing their faces as it dawns on them who is going to be here.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes pledges support for the under-fire opener Ben Duckett, following some social media backlash.

items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes has thrown a protective arm around his beleaguered side and pledged his support for under-fire opener Ben Duckett.

items.title: Archer ruled out of Ashes as England make two changes for Boxing Day Test
items.summary: England's Ashes tour lurched to a fresh low as their player of the series, Jofra Archer, was ruled out of the remaining two Tests through injury.

items.summary: From a dramatic Transfer Deadline Day in January to success with England and Arsenal, 2025 has been a year of contrasts for Chloe Kelly, writes Anton Toloui...

items.title: Arsenal survive 'emotionally tough' Palace shootout
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said it was "emotionally tough" to accept Crystal Palace's stoppage-time equaliser before his team went on to win 8-7 on penalties following a 1-1 draw in their Carabao Cup quarterfinal.

items.title: NWSL OK's 'Rodman rule' even as union objects
items.summary: The NWSL on Tuesday announced the creation of what has been referred to internally as the "High Impact Player" rule (HIP), which would allow teams to spend up to $1 million outside of the salary cap on star players.

items.title: USMNT's Richards stretchered off in Carabao Cup
items.summary: Crystal Palace and United States defender Chris Richards was taken from the field on a stretcher during his team's Carabao Cup game against Arsenal on Tuesday.
